name: Orange Cauliflower
description: Orange Cauliflower is a vegetarian version of the popular Chinese orange chicken! And honestly, you won't miss the meat at all. The sticky orange sauce is incredibly addicting, and the cauliflower is baked, not fried.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup flour (see notes for gluten free)
2 cups panko breadcrumbs (see notes for gluten free)
1 cup orange juice, fresh squeezed preferred
1/2 cup granulated sugar (see notes for substitutions)
2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce (or tamari for gluten free)
2 garlic  cloves, or 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
4 cups cooked brown or white rice

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

itemListElement.text: Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.
itemListElement.name: Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, add water, flour, garlic powder and salt. Whisk until well combined. Place the breadcrumbs in a medium sized bowl and set it next to the wet batter bowl. Also place your baking sheet nearby.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, add water, flour, garlic powder and salt. Whisk until well combined. Place the breadcrumbs in a medium sized bowl and set it next to the wet batter bowl. Also place your baking sheet nearby.

itemListElement.text: Add the cauliflower to the bowl with the wet batter and toss to combine, coating all the pieces well.
itemListElement.name: Add the cauliflower to the bowl with the wet batter and toss to combine, coating all the pieces well.

itemListElement.text: One by one, remove a cauliflower piece, tapping any excess batter off, and roll in the breadcrumbs to coat. Place on the prepared baking sheet and make sure they are not touching each other, or they will all get stuck together as they bake.
itemListElement.name: One by one, remove a cauliflower piece, tapping any excess batter off, and roll in the breadcrumbs to coat. Place on the prepared baking sheet and make sure they are not touching each other, or they will all get stuck together as they bake.

itemListElement.text: Bake for about 20-30 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
itemListElement.name: Bake for about 20-30 minutes until golden brown and crispy.

itemListElement.text: In a large pan (large enough to fit the cauliflower and sauce), add all sauce ingredients except the cornstarch and water. Bring to a boil, and cook for a minute or two.
itemListElement.name: In a large pan (large enough to fit the cauliflower and sauce), add all sauce ingredients except the cornstarch and water. Bring to a boil, and cook for a minute or two.

itemListElement.text: Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl to combine, and then add to the pot. Stir over medium-high heat constantly for a couple of minutes, until the sauce thickens.
itemListElement.name: Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl to combine, and then add to the pot. Stir over medium-high heat constantly for a couple of minutes, until the sauce thickens.

itemListElement.text: Once the cauliflower is done, add it to the pan with the orange sauce and stir to coat. There won't be a lot of extra sauce; if you want more double the sauce.
itemListElement.name: Once the cauliflower is done, add it to the pan with the orange sauce and stir to coat. There won't be a lot of extra sauce; if you want more double the sauce.

itemListElement.text: Serve over brown or white rice. Sprinkle with green onions and/or sesame seeds. Serve hot and enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Serve over brown or white rice. Sprinkle with green onions and/or sesame seeds. Serve hot and enjoy!
